doc.source_uri: 2025-08-31/Shenhua - AH First Take In-line 2Q25 earnings dividend payment as promisedShenhua - AH First Take In-line 2Q25 earnings _2025-08-31

passages.text: This material is neither intended to be distributed to Mainland China investors nor to provide securities investment consultancy services within the territory of Mainland China. This material or any portion hereof may not be reprinted, sold or redistributed without the written consent of J.P. Morgan.

Our First Take: Shenhua 2Q25 earnings came in at \(\mathrm{Rmb}12.7\mathrm{bn}\) \((- 7\%)\) YoY, \(+6\%\) QoQ), at the mid- point of its preannounced \(\mathrm{Rmb}11.7 - 13.7\mathrm{bn}\) Segment- wise, its unit of GP remained flattish QoQ at \(\mathrm{Rmb}192 / \mathrm{t}\) with cost reduction offsetting the decline of ASP. Meanwhile, the unit GP of its power segment has increased to \(\mathrm{Rmb}46 / \mathrm{MWh}\) vs \(\mathrm{Rmb}32\mathrm{MWh}\) of 1Q25 given lower coal prices. Shenhua has announced its first interim DPS of \(\mathrm{Rmb}0.98 / \mathrm{sh}\) , implying a \(79\%\) payout ratio (vs. \(77\%\) in 1H24). Despite recent coal price volatility on the back of anti- involution, we believe maintaining a reasonable coal price level and ensuring a stable supply of coal is still the top priority.

Strong cost control despite lower coal price: Thermal coal spot price in 2Q25 has dropped \(12\%\) QoQ. As Shenhua has a high \(\%\) of LT contracts, ASP of self- produced coal was only \(2\%\) lower QoQ. However, its unit cost of self- produced coal dropped further by \(4\%\) QoQ to \(\mathrm{Rmb}280 / \mathrm{t}\) , resulting in a higher unit GP at \(\mathrm{Rmb}192 / \mathrm{t}\)
First time interim dividend payment: Shenhua announced its first- ever interim DPS of \(\mathrm{Rmb}0.98 / \mathrm{sh}\) , implying a \(79\%\) payout ratio (vs. \(77\%\) in FY24).

Monthly LT contract rose against annual LT contract. Although the overall \(\%\) LT contract remains stable at \(93\%\) , monthly LT as \(\%\) of Shenhua's total shipment has increased to \(45\%\) vs \(30 - 35\%\) previously. Exposing more to spot price could be a double- edged sword under current coal price volatility, in our view.
Shenhua's 1H25 NPAT tracks \(48\%\) of Bloomberg consensus and we expect the consensus be largely unchanged.
Expect muted share price reaction.
Shenhua will host an analyst briefing on Sep 5 (Fri) 5pm HKT.
601088. SS, 601088 CH Neutral Price: \(\mathrm{Rmb}37.47\) 29 Aug 2025 Price Target: \(\mathrm{Rmb}40.00\) PT End Date: 31 Dec 2026
1088. HK, 1088 HK Neutral Price: \(\mathrm{HK}\) 34.88 29 Aug 2025 Price Target: \(\mathrm{HK}\) 33.00 PT End Date: 31 Dec 2026

J.P. Morgan does and seeks to do business with companies covered in its research reports. As a result, investors should be aware that the firm may have a conflict of interest that could affect the objectivity of this report. Investors should consider this report as only a single factor in making their investment decision.
Table 1: Shenhua 1H25 Results Summary
Source: Company report, J.P. Morgan.

Shenhua Energy stands out as a leading player in the coal industry and is the world's largest listed coal miner. We think Shenhua is the most defensive coal name under a coal price downtrend with \(80\%\) of sales locked with long- term contract pricing. We believe investors would favor Shenhua's high payout ratio/dividend yield against the current uncertain macro backdrop. We rate Shenhua- A Neutral, however, due to our concerns on the coal price outlook.
Our Dec- 26 PT for Shenhua- A is Rmb40, based on our NPV valuation rounded off to the nearest yuan, using a discount rate of \(9.7\%\) .

Shenhua Energy stands out as a leading player in the coal industry and is the world's largest listed coal miner. We think Shenhua is the most defensive coal name under a coal price downtrend with \(80\%\) of sales locked with long- term contract pricing. We believe investors would favor Shenhua's high payout ratio/dividend yield against the current uncertain macro backdrop. We rate Shenhua- H Neutral, however, due to our concerns on the coal price outlook.
Our Dec- 26 PT for Shenhua- H is HK\$33, based on an average 3- month rolling A- H premium of \(30\%\) applied to our A- share NPV valuation.

J.P. Morgan uses the following rating system: Overweight (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will outperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe); Neutral (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will perform in line with the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe); and Underweight (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will underperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe. NR is Not Rated. In this case, J.P. Morgan has removed the rating and, if applicable, the price target, for this stock because of either a lack of a sufficient fundamental basis or for legal, regulatory or policy reasons. The previous rating and, if applicable, the price target, no longer should be relied upon. An NR designation is not a recommendation or a rating. In Americas equity research, some stocks under coverage have a rating but no price target; in these cases, we expect the stock will outperform/perform in line/underperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe over the next six to 12 months. In our Asia (ex-Australia and ex-India) and U.K. small- and mid-cap Equity Research, each stock's expected total return is compared to the expected total return of a benchmark country market index, not to those Research Analysts' coverage universe. If it does not appear in the Important Disclosures section of this report, the certifying Research Analyst's coverage universe can be found on J.P. Morgan's Research website, https://www.jpmorganmarkets.com.
